120.9, 127.4, 128.2 (2C), 128.8, 129.3 (2C), 135.7, 138.6, 140.0, 145.3, 147.7, 154.5. MS (ESI) m / z: 314 ( 79 Br) and 316 ( 81 Br) ([M + H] + , 70), 336 ( 79 Br) and 338 ( 81 Br) ([M + Na] + , 80). ), 651 ([2M + Na] + , 100).

I. 7. Synthesis of compounds 8

To a solution of compound 4bc (208 mg, 0.89 mmol, 1 equiv) in anhydrous dichloromethane at room temperature is added 18 mg of N-chlorosuccinimide (1.07 mmol, 1.2 equiv). The reaction medium is then refluxed with CH 2 Cl 2 overnight. After cooling, the reaction medium is hydrolysed with a 5% NaOH solution and then extracted 3 times with CH 2 Cl 2. The organic phases are combined, washed with saturated NaCl solution, dried over Na 2 SC 4 and then dried. concentrated under reduced pressure to give 279 mg of the desired product.

Yield: 99% (279 mg). 1 H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl 3 ) δ ppm: 2.73 (s, 3H), 4.60 (brs, 2H NH), 7.19 (d, J = 9.2 Hz, 1H), 7.48 (m, 3H), 7.71 ( dd, J = 8.6 and 1.3 Hz, 2H), 7.45 (d, J = 9.2 Hz, 1H). 13 C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl 3 ) δ ppm: 23.7, 1.1, 120.8, 127.3, 128.3 (2C), 128.9, 129.3 (2C), 136.4, 139.0, 139.1, 143.6, 148.3, 154.6.

I.8. Synthesis of compounds 9

To a solution of compound 4bc (200 mg, 0.85 mmol, 1 equiv) in anhydrous dimethylformamide is added 18 mg of K 2 CO 3 (0.85 mmol, 1 equiv), 141 mg of KI (0 85 mmol, 1 equiv.) And 0.19 ml of propargyl bromide (1.7 mmol, 2 equiv). The reaction medium is then heated at 100 ° C. for 24 hours. After cooling, the reaction medium is hydrolysed with a saturated solution of K 2 CO 3 , and then extracted 3 times with ethyl acetate. The organic phases are combined, washed with saturated NaCl solution, dried over Na 2 SO 4 and then concentrated under reduced pressure. Purification by chromatography on silica gel in a mixture of cyclohexane: ethyl acetate in proportions of 7: 3 and then 6: 4 afforded the compound 9bc (the majority, 90, 1 mg) and the dialkylated compound (minor, 14 mg, not described).

Yield: 40% (90, 1mg). 1 H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl 3 ) δ ppm: 2.23 (t, J = 2.4 Hz, 1H), 2.67 (s, 3H), 4.01 (brs, 2H), 4.56 (brs, 1H, NH) , 7.09 (dd, J = 2.6 and 8.8 Hz, 1H), 7.12 (d, J = 2.6 Hz, 1H), 7.43-7.50 (m, 3H), 7.61 (dd, J = 1, 6 and 8.8 Hz, 2H), 7.81 (d, J = 8.8 Hz, 1H). NMR li C (100 MHz, CDC1 3) δ ppm: 23.6, 33.3, 71.7, 79.9, 105.2, 121.6, 128.3 (2C), 128.6, 128.8 (2C), 128.9, 136.3, 139.4, 142.8, 147.3, 147.9, 154.6 . MS (ESI) m / z: 274.2 ([M + H] + , 100). Purity (HPLC / UV 260 nm): 100%.

Yield: 41% (2.570 g). MS (ESI) m / z 198.2 ([M + H] + , 100). Purity (HPLC / UV 220 nm): 94%. II. Biological evaluation

 Amino-quinoxalines were then evaluated for their neuroprotective and neurodifferentiating (or neuritogenic) properties.

 II.1 Effect of compounds on the neuroprotection and differentiation of dopaminergic neurons in primary culture in a model of spontaneous degeneration.

II.1.1 Structure-activity relationship and determination of the effective concentration (EC50) • The quinoxaline derivatives were tested on a model of spontaneous degeneration of dopaminergic neurons in culture according to the protocol described in the article by F. Schmidt et al. PLoS ONE 2009, 4 (7) e2615 ("Chemicals Possessing a Neurotrophin-Like Activity on Dopaminergic Neurons in Primary Culture"). This model consists in the culture of ventral mesencephalon of rat embryo. This part of the brain in culture contains a proportion of dopaminergic neurons of 5% of the total neurons, the other neurons being essentially GABAergic. These cultures are also composed of glial cells namely astrocytes, oligodendrocytes and microglia. These cultures are characterized by the progressive death of neurons. The neuroprotective effect of the compounds according to the invention was evaluated by counting dopaminergic neurons (TH + ) labeled by immunohistochemistry of tyrosine hydroxylase (TH) after 8 days of culture. Thus, for example, the compounds 4aa, 4ba, 4ad, 4bd, 4bc and 4ed have been evaluated at ΙηΜ, ΙΟηΜ, ΙΟΟηΜ and Ι μΜ and compared to the activity of cyclic dibutyryl-AMP (dbc-AMP) at 200 μΜ.

Table 1. Activity of certain aminoquinoxaline derivatives at ΙΟΟηΜ on the survival of fetal dopaminergic neurons in culture.

 The results show a particularly important activity of compound 4bc with a percentage of survival almost equal to that induced by dbc-AMP. In addition, a particularly advantageous activity is observed for the compounds substituted in
